title: Manchester City 5-1 Bournemouth: Sterling hat trick keeps City top
text:
Manchester City 5-1 Bournemouth: Sterling hat trick keeps City top 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
In the English Premier League, Manchester City were looking to maintain their grip on top spot in the standings as they welcomed EPL newcomers Bournemouth to the Etihad, and the Citizens would get a shimmering effort from prize offseason addition Raheem Sterling, as the 20-year-old midfielder demonstrated the lethal striking ability the hosts expect to see regularly, after paying Liverpool a national record transfer fee of nearly 50 million pounds to acquire him this past summer.Sterling would find the back of the net three times in the first half -- scoring in the 7th, 29th, and 45th minutes -- with Wilfred Bony adding a pair of goals in the 11th and 89th to complete Man City's total domination of the Cherries, whose only goal came from Glenn Murray in the 22nd minute. And after the match, Manuel Pellegrini had plenty of praise for his 20-year-old rising star, Sterling. "Well, I think it was very important for him to score in this game three goals. It's important for him to improve his finishing - I think that he did it today. He's a very young player and I'm sure that he will continue improving in the future," said Manuel Pellegrini, Manchester City manager.
